> This looks like a good idea. I'm a little unsure about one webpack config per vendor library (even if they are autogenerated). But I also couldn't figure out a way to make ExportedSymbols work another way.

The hard part is the `output.library` option. If that supported multiple entry points better, we could get the rest of the info from the compilation object and loop through each asset.
body_text:
This looks like a good idea. I'm a little unsure about one webpack config per vendor library (even if they are autogenerated). But I also couldn't figure out a way to make ExportedSymbols work another way.

The hard part is the output.library option. If that supported multiple entry points better, we could get the rest of the info from the compilation object and loop through each asset.
body_html:
This looks like a good idea. I'm a little unsure about one webpack config per vendor library (even if they are autogenerated). But I also couldn't figure out a way to make ExportedSymbols work another way.

The hard part is the output.library option. If that supported multiple entry points better, we could get the rest of the info from the compilation object and loop through each asset.
